data.title: 准备以至少20秒的时间回答以下问题
data.answer: North China is a geographical region of China, consisting of the provinces of Beijing, Tianjin, Hebei, Shanxi and Inner Mongolia. It lies in north of the Qinling Huaihe Line, with its heartland in the North China Plain. In modern times, the area has shifted in terms of socio-political and economic composition. Nowadays the unique North Chinese culture is partly influenced by Marxism, Soviet systems of industry while preserving a traditional Chinese indigenous culture. Northern China is widely known to be the area that Chinese civilization began, along the infamous Yellow River that encompasses Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, Henan, Hebei and Shandong Provinces through this region. For a large part of Chinese history, northern China was economically more advanced than southern China. It has been home to many different Empires stretching back several millennias. Northern China has been the witness to many invasions from different empires including the most notable one by the Mongolian Hordes of Genghis Khan and the Manchu Tribes of the Northeast. Northern China has always been an agricultural and industrial based economy with many manufacturing and energy plants being built here.（181字）
data.referenceText: Describe the land and culture of the people that live in the northern part of your country.
data.referenceTranslate: 描述你国家北部的土地和人民的文化。
